New Arrivals

Content 3 Up 2: Images Left

Path: src/inc/components/content_3_up/content_3_up_v2.html

Step 1

Start with a Neutral Base

Nothing quite compares to clean, crisp, white bedding.

When it comes to the basic set of sheets keep the following in mind:

  • Stick to neutral tones for versatility
  • Whites and delicate creams are ideal
  • Neutral tones allow you to easily add color and texture onto the base
  • Keep the sheets void of busy patterns or prints, reserving them for the duvets and throws
Shop Sheets

Content 3 Up 2: Images Right

Path: src/inc/components/content_3_up/content_3_up_v2_right.html

Step 2

Introduce Color

Add a pop of color through an unexpected element.

Here’s your opportunity to set the chromatic tone for the overall look:

  • We opted for a lightly textured top sheet in a moody shade of vintage indigo.
  • Although it’ll remain mostly covered in the end, the sliver of it that shows will impart the bedding with a dynamic finish.
Shop Products
